document.evidence: Abstract Existing studies show that a weighted context-free transduction of reasonable quality can be effectively learned from examples .
document.text: Abstract Existing studies show that a weighted context-free transduction of reasonable quality can be effectively learned from examples .
document.claim_evidence: a weighted context-free transduction of reasonable quality can be effectively learned from examples

document.text: This paper investigates the approximation of such transduction by means of weighted rational transduc tion .
The advantage is increased pro cessing speed , which benefits real time applications involving spoken lan guage .

document.claim: context-free transduction has a relatively high accuracymay be difficult to obtain robustness without further increasing the time costs
document.text: Conclusions For our application , context-free transduction has a relatively high accuracy , but it also has a high time consumption , and it may be difficult to obtain robustness without further increasing the time costs .
These are two major obstacles for use in spoken language systems .
